name: Gidleigh Park Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had decided to go to Gidleigh Park for lunch only after Alex Polizzi saying how fab it was. Well............before we got to the door it was opened for us and from then on courtesy, attention and extremely pleasant staff made this an experience that will have to be repeated when we have saved up enough again!! The Hotel is in amazing grounds, the views are spectacular and I dont know if I can find the words to describe the michelin star food or the wine we were recommended, but it was the best Sancerre I have ever had and I didnt know that food could taste like that!!! Well done to ever single person there, you deserve every award you have and some that havent been invented!!!... When something is as expensive as Gidleigh is you do expect high standards, but Gidleigh doesn't disapoint! Thank you all for a very special memory.
reviews.title: Old world elegance!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: from the moment you drive up the narrow drive, you get a glimpse of the magnificent Tudor /Edwardian building which holds a truly amazing experience. The staff are impeccably trained being discreet and efficient whilst being warm,charming and helpful.All dietary needs are catered for without compromise and with minimum fuss.The dishes are presented with a brief description by the staff which leaves you wanting to taste each individual component to see how it compliments the dish as a whole. It was truly an assault on your taste sensation as well as the eyes. he chefs are extremely talented and must be commended.All the homeward journey we kept thinking of the new taste experience to talk about - and it was well worth the 240 mile round trip.
reviews.title: An amazing assault on your gastronomic senses

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: As a treat I took some of my staff for a lunch at the end of January and as we are in the catering industry as well, albeit a much smaller operation, I wanted to open their minds as to what can be achievable. It was a wonderful day and gave us all inspiration. From the beginning to the end we were looked after by great staff, some stupendous food, expensive you might think, but this is a labour of love and the passion flows through and by the time you pay you understand how much work is put in to achieve these results.
reviews.title: time to relax, enjoy and take it all in

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was very cheeky and asked if we could see the cellar, I am sure they don't want to be invaded with guests asking for a tour all the time, but the gentleman was very obliging, and to top it all Mr.Caines gave us a quick insight into his kitchen. Thankyou it was much appreciated , but unfortunately my staff now think we need a million other things in our kitchen!!Go to Gidleigh Park and enjoy.
reviews.title: Exceptional Restuarant and Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for two nights and made the classic mistake of eating away from the hotel on the Friday evening, when we had a very disappointing experience (see separate review). Breakfast on Saturday morning was fabulous and followed by a beautiful walk through the amazing grounds of the hotel. Quite. The most beautiful setting and easy to lose two hours just exploring. The river passes through beautiful water gardens before rushing past he hotel and the whole setting is quite exquisite.
reviews.title: Style, beauty and elegance.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012
reviews.text: wonderful 3 nights stay faultless. So looking forward to another break at gidleigh in few months time. Outstanding service food & so easy to relax.
reviews.title: Another wonderful stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at Gidleigh Park in March, clebrating our wedding anniversary. What a wonderful experience. The staff are freindly and courteous, the hotel a haven of tranquillity set in beautiful countryside and the food.... it's hard find words that will do justice to the wonderful cuisine, it was superb. Would I recommend this hotel to anyone....YES! Will we be going again....most certainly.
reviews.title: A wonderful experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A flawless dining experience, the tasting menu is sublime. Everything from the service, ambience, food, setting etc is perfect. Will be returning again, although only on a very special occasion as its rather pricey (but certainly value for money).
reviews.title: The best in the South West

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Last Friday (30/3/12) we went with good friends to celebrate their joint birthdays ,for lunch at
reviews.title: SPECIAL BIRTHDAYS @GIDLEIGH PARK

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011
reviews.text: this beautifull place.Everything was as good ,if not better than we expected-not only was the
reviews.title: An excellent experience!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011
reviews.text: Arrived for weekend had picnic in backpack ordered had lovely walk within boundaries. Rooms are super, staff pleasant and very helpful. Food as you would expect flavours you take home with you. Do have wine flight with meal. Will return soon
reviews.title: Wonderful relaxing stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed one night and thoroughly enjoyed it. We went for 2hour walk and it is beautiful. Room excellent, did have a free upgrade! Bath overlooking river.
reviews.title: fantastic hotel and gardens

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Dinner lovely, restaurant could be a little quiet but lady on next table to us obviously had too much to drink and was very loud and amusing.
reviews.title: Sensational food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the second half of our gastronomic honeymoon we ventured down to Devon to Gidleigh Park. At the end of the very long and very narrow drive lay a beautiful house set in wonderful grounds, our expectations, which had already been boosted by a trip to Le Manoir, increased exponentially. We were greeted very warmly and shown to our room (Laughter) which had the most spectacular view of the grounds and the river running through.
reviews.title: Excellence...but at a price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although the setting of Gidleigh is incredible the actual atmosphere in the hotel was more akin to that of a library, although this could have been to do with the fact we went mid-week and the rest of the clientele were a lot older than us. They do need to work at getting more of a vibe in the communal rooms. This was mirrored a bit in the rooms where although beautifully done we could hear all the floorboards creaking above and then in the mornings all the cleaners could be heard in the corridor.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel, Stunning location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012
reviews.text: A beautiful hotel, quintessentially English country house. Wellies by the door, Labrador wandering around, fantastic grounds, great rooms, staff, dinner, wine and food.
reviews.title: Lovely, nearly perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012
reviews.text: I last visited with some seriously foodie friends and we were lucky enough to have a surprise Tasting menu. Fabulous and one of the top three meals I have ever eaten.
reviews.title: Amazing!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A minor issue is that breakfast is a bit disappointing, but not enough to award less than 5/5 overall. If this could be fixed then this would be absolutely the best country house hotel I have stayed at.
reviews.title: Heaven in Devon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband & I went for lunch for our anniversary & it was the most amazing experience from start to finish. The service was impeccable, the food was not only presented beautifully but everything had such amazing flavours.
reviews.title: OMG

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is expensive but you get what you pay for & it really was faultless.
reviews.title: Amazing location and dinner!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is set in a beautiful location and feels very relaxed and peaceful. Beautiful from the outside, inside the main rooms are beautifully done but quite old fashioned and traditional in style. Lovely just not totally my choice.vthe lounge was lovely with big comfy sofas and views over the gardens but the dining room was a bit disappointing. The rooms however were a very pleasant surprise. We had a classic basic room Hammeldown and it was beautiful and much more contemporary in style than I'd have expected. Exceptionally comfy bed, spacious and with an amazing bathroom with huge walkin shower and big bath. Lots of large size l,occitane toiletries too and a decanter of port to help yourself to in the room. We also liked the pantry where you can help yourself to tea coffee nice biscuits and snacks at any time of day.
reviews.title: Beautiful rooms and great food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The main reason to visit though is of course the food and it didn't disappoint. They do 3 menus and we had the 5 course rather than 3 or 8. All of the food was superb, especially foie GRAS and an amazing cherry dessert.
reviews.title: fantastic lunch

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is not cheap. We stayed one night and including dinner our bill came to 750 pounds! However the food is fantastic service was excellent and it is a very relaxing place to visit.
reviews.title: A perfect stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we had lunch here for my birthday and it was really fabulous. great service, great food. fantastic bottle of wine, wow what a selection they have! will be back for afternoon tea soon.
reviews.title: Great food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: also, they have KENNELS, so if you have dogs then they can relax while you eat, yay!
reviews.title: Special treat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We visited Gidleigh Park on a 2 night 'Gourmet Getaway' break on the most perfect autumn weekend. The property is beautiful, the room very comfortable, opening straight onto the garden. While the staff are respectful and attentive as you would expect from a hotel of this calibre, they were also very friendly and welcoming with no hint of arrogance.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay and fabulous food
Sublime
reviews.text: The food was wonderful, as you would expect from a restaurant with 2 Michelin stars. Style of cooking less formal and 'French' than some of its competitors, but all the better for it! We had the 8-course tasting menu one night (with accompanying wine flight) and the A La Carte on the second night. The package included a very enjoyable picnic lunch which was provided in a backpack so that we could spend the day hiking on Dartmoor.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all, this could not have been bettered as a wonderful, peaceful retreat.
reviews.title: birthday treat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's hard to find any faults with Gidleigh Park. Everything about it is wonderful, from the hotel itself to the staff and the standard of the food. It's true that the road to it is a little intimidating but once you are there you are in a different world. We were lucky to have incredible weather and so once we arrived we just explored the grounds and didn't bother to venture out during our two night break. Even the picnic lunch supplied as part of our Gourmet Getaway package was lovely. Can't wait to return and we're already saving up.
reviews.title: A wonderful country retreat.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staayed for one night in September as a birthday suprise. Could not fault it. Absolute class from the moment you arrive. Had the 'signature menu' for dinner with the wine flight. It was the most memorable meal of my life! absolutely amazing. This is a perfect example of how the service industry in Britain performs at the very top of its game. Will certainly be returning.
reviews.title: Loved it !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place is amazing. Somewhat traumatic to find down narrow lanes - follow their directions, turn off the satnav.
reviews.title: A very special place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in a master room at the front, which was amazing, with a view over the grounds and stream. The room itself was spacious, very comfortable and well appointed. The king bed was very comfortable, and provided an excellent sleep.
reviews.title: Once in a lifetime.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bathroom was huge, very well appointed and amazing
reviews.title: Exacting standards, wonderful service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We dined in house and the restaurant is outstanding. Food and wine excellent. Service was amazing - almost too much attention.
reviews.title: WOW WOW WOW

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was excellent too.
reviews.title: Faultless

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: GP is a wonderful place. Stunning grounds, impeccable service of the quietly understated English variety, and of course the fabulous food...
reviews.title: Absolute perfection in every sense

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: The prices keep GP exclusive, and every little detail is simply of the highest quality, from the materials , linens etc in the bedrooms, to the ingredients in the food. The main course of Turbot with pork belly and scallops is the finest dish I have ever eaten. Sumptuous lounge with roaring fire, oak panels, views over the gardens. Go in autumn to see the stunning colours, and cosy up by the fire after dinner. Wine list very impressive indeed. Chose the room with the rooftop hot tub, or the one with the built in sauna!
reviews.title: Dream

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011
reviews.text: It’s a wonderful place and I hesitated before writing about it because one would like to keep it a secret. I guess it’s not anyway considering all the reviews. So I can only go along with all the positive ones
reviews.title: Lovely, but not Bovey Castle

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011
reviews.text: What I liked most was the very nice staff, the beautiful bedroom with a view (that one I’ll keep secret), the general atmosphere. You’re among professionals in hosting, but neither people nor atmosphere is too stiffed like you would unfortunately experience in this class of hotel. It’s just the right combination of relaxed and efficient: perfect.
reviews.title: Just perfect.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: I also went for beautiful hikes leaving from the hotel door.
reviews.title: A delight from start to finish

description: Charming, Tudor-style country house hotel set in 45 acres of secluded gardens and woodlands – 2 miles west of Chagford on the banks of the North Teign River.
